description: A simple, sweet, and comforting side dish made by boiling and mashing orange-fleshed sweet potatoes, often enriched with a touch of ghee or milk for creaminess.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: Sweet potato mash is a popular, affordable, and nutritious side dish, especially in regions where sweet potatoes are a major crop. It is a common first solid food for babies and a comforting dish for all ages, valued for its natural sweetness and energy-giving properties.

ingredients.name: Orange Sweet Potatoes
ingredients.notes: Peeled and chopped into large chunks

steps.instruction: Peel the sweet potatoes and chop them into roughly 2-inch chunks. This helps them cook evenly and quickly.
Place the chopped sweet potatoes in a medium saucepan. Add the water and a pinch of salt.
Bring the water to a boil over high heat. Then, reduce the heat to medium, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes.

cooking_indicators.visual: potatoes are very tender and can be easily pierced with a fork

steps.instruction: Once the sweet potatoes are fully cooked, drain any remaining water using a colander.
Return the drained sweet potatoes to the warm pot. Add the ghee or butter (if using) and the salt.
Use a potato masher to mash the sweet potatoes until smooth. For an extra smooth consistency, you can use a wooden spoon to beat it vigorously.
Gradually add the milk or warm water, a little at a time, and continue mashing or stirring until you achieve your desired creamy and smooth consistency.
Taste and adjust the seasoning, adding more salt if needed. Serve immediately while hot.
Serve the sweet potato mash hot as a side dish.

serving_suggestions: A perfect side for meat stews (like beef, chicken, or liver), fish, or bean dishes. It can also be eaten on its own.
